question:
(a) Draw a sketch map of Nigeria. On the map, locate and name: (i) Owerri. lbadan and Birnin Kebbi; (ii) Cross River and Fadarna plains of River Sokoto.
(b) Outline four factors that encourage tourism in Nigeria
(c) Highlight three problems hindering tourism in Nigeria.
answer:
(a) Map of Nigeria showing (i) Ibadan, (ii) Owerri (iii) Bernin Kebbi (iv) Fadama plain of Sokoto and Cross river.

(b) Factors that encourage tourism in Nigeria: 
(i) Favourable climate (ii) Beautiful sceneries' e.g sandy beaches, caves, etc 
(iii) Relative political stability (iv) Interesting culture/festivals (v) Wildlife (vi) Nature reserves 
(vii) Historical monuments/sites 
(viii) Hospitality of the people (ix) Publicity 
(x) Relative security (.xi) Hotels of international 
standard (xii)Availability of capital 
(xiii) Outstanding Inan-made features. e.g Kainji dam. National theatre. National parks, etc. 
(xiv) Availability good transport network 
(xv) Availability of communication network 
(xvi)Appreciation of leisure 
(xvii) Favourable government policy 
(xviii) Need to earn foreign exchange. 

(c) Problems hindering tourism in Nigeria 
(i) Inadequate accommodation 
(ii) Inadequate capital/funding 
(iii) Heavy tax on tourism entrepreneurs 
(iv) Low patronage (v) Poor sanitation 
(vi) Poor transportation network (vii) Competition from sister countries (viii) Insecurity/political problems 
(ix) Inadequate publicity/awareness (x) Limited holiday centres (xi) Inability to explore and develop new tourist attractions/destinations
(xii) Poor quality services 
(xiii) Easy spread of.diseases (xiv) Low income level
(xv) Limited local entrepreneurship (xvi) Poor management (xvii) Inconsistent government policies 
(xviii) Poor infrastructure/social amenities (xix) Negative reportage (xx) Inefficient communication network 
(xxi) High cost of services/inflation (xxii) Deforestation (xxiii) Bush burning

question:

(b) Highlight four contributions of transportation to the economic development of Nigeria.
(c) Outline three problems limiting rail transportation in Nigeria.
answer:
(a) Map of Nigeria showing : (i) Major road from Lagos to Portharcourt (ii) Railway line from Lagos to Kano. 

(b) Contributions of transportation to the economic development of Nigeria: 
(i) Movement of people
(ii) Movement of goods
(iii) Creation of job opportunities 
(iv) Promote internal trade (v) Promote
international trade (vi) Income to workers 
(vii) promotes national integration (viii) 
opening up new areas for development

(.xi) Infrastructural development

(c) Problems limiting rail transportation ill 
Nigeria: (i) Slow speed (ii) Narrow gauge 
(iii) Low patronage
(iv) High cost of construction (v) Poor management (vi) Inadequate skilled technicians

(x) Old/outdated coaches (xi) Poor time schedules (xii) Difficult terrain (xiii) Derailment due to flooding (xiv) Poor communication
